Package com.doa.engine.scene

Class DoaObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.doa.engine.scene.DoaObject
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DoaUIComponent
    public abstract class DoaObject
extends Object
implements Serializable
    Blueprint of all objects that are going to be processed by DoaEngine, all objects that will get updated at every logical frame and will get drawn on the screen must sub-class this class, then it is ensured by DoaEngine that it will be updated and will be drawn on the screen.
    Since:
    DoaEngine 1.0
    Version:
    2.7
    Author:
    Doga Oruc
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • tick

        public abstract void tick()
        This method is required to be public, but should never be called explicitly by any class at any time except DoaEngine. If done otherwise, DoaEngine provides no guarantees on the consistency of the internal state of this DoaObject. All updates to a DoaObject's internal state must be executed inside this method. When done so, DoaEngine guarantees the object's new internal state will reflect to object's drawing on the screen

      • render

        public abstract void render​(DoaGraphicsContext g)
        This method is required to be public, but should never be called explicitly by any class at any time except DoaEngine. If done otherwise, DoaEngine provides no guarantees on the quality and consistency of rendering. All draw calls regarding a DoaObject's internal state must be executed inside this method. This method is always executed on time.
        Parameters:
        g - the graphics context of DoaEngine

      • getBounds

        public Shape getBounds()
        Conveniency method to retrieve a DoaObject's bounds, added to DoaObject because of how useful it is for collision detection. By default, returns the smallest bounding box for this object.
        Returns:
        the bounding shape of DoaObject

      • setScene

        @Internal
public void setScene​(DoaScene scene)
        Sets the scene of this DoaObject. This method is an internal component, therefore it should never be called!. Use DoaScene.add(DoaObject) and DoaScene.remove(DoaObject) to set the scene of a DoaObject.
        Parameters:
        scene - scene
        See Also:
        DoaScene.add(DoaObject), DoaScene.remove(DoaObject)
